channel.generator: NSW National Parks and Wildlife Service
channel.title: NSW National Parks - Fires, floods and park closures
channel.description: This RSS feed provides information on current fires, floods, park closures, fire bans and hazard reduction burns for parks and reserves throughout NSW.

item.title: Abercrombie River National Park
item.description:
HAZARD REDUCTION BURNS
Hazard reduction burn
Tea Tree West Hazard Reduction 
Bounded by: Felled Timber Creek, Claytons Fire Trail, Tea Tree Fire Trail.
No closures to Abercrombie campsites, but the above Fire Trails will be closed.
 Contact Oberon NPWS 63361972

item.title: Arakwal National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Tallow Beach Road and walking track will be closed during the proposed hazard reduction burn
The NPWS is proposing to undertake a hazard reduction burn on the north-western area of Arakwal National Park, Byron Bay.  The proposed burn will be undertaken in September to October.  The exact timing of the burn is dependant upon forecast weather conditions and subsequently may be postponed if conditions are not favourable.  On the day of the burn traffic control measures will be put in place.  During the burn operation Tallow Beach Road and walking track will be closed to pedestrian and vehicle traffic as well as entry to Cosy Corner picnic and car park area.  The Milne Street track to the beach will also be closed to the public.  The hazard reduction burn is expected to be undertaken during the day with a follow up mop up the next day.

item.title: Barrington Tops National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Gloucester Falls Walk Partially Closed - Gloucester Falls Track
Gloucester Falls Walk is currently partially CLOSED, access to lookouts are still available, however the loop walk is not possible due to severe track damage. Please contact Gloucester National Parks Office for more information on 65385300.
Numerous Tree Falls have blocked Antartic Beech Forest Track - Antarctic Beech Forest Track
Gloucester Tops - Antarctic Beech Forest Track "long walk" is currently partially closed - "short walk" is still available to visitors. Due to safety concerns over numerous tree falls, the Antarctic Beech Forest Long Walk is currently restricted to the northern section of the walk as far as the Beech Forest waterfall.
Seasonal Closure of Barrington Trail (South) - Barrington trail
Barrington Trail now open to Junction Pools and Little Murray. 
Access beyond Junction Pools turn off out to Mount Barrington still closed to vehicles.
 National Parks Gloucester Office 65385300.

item.title: Barrington Tops State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
4 Tonne Load Limit Tubrubucca Road
Motorists are advised that for safety, a 4 Tonne Load Limit has been applied to Tubrabucca Road, due to bridge damage & on-going degradation.
For further information contact NPWS Upper Hunter Area on 02 6540 2300.

item.title: Ben Boyd National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Road and walking track closures - Green Cape to Pulpit Rock
Due to weather damage, Pulpit Rock Road off Green Cape Road is closed and the 4WD trail to Mowarry Point is closed due to a bridge failure.
Access from the walking track to the rock platform at Haycock Point (Ben Boyd National Park North) has been closed in the interests of public safety. Please use alternate flagged route to access the rock platform.
The steps down to the beach below the Pinnacles walking track are closed.  The Pinnacles loop walk is open however.

item.title: Blue Mountains National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Breakfast Point - Breakfast Point Lookout
Breakfast Point Lookout at Wentworth Falls is closed until further notice.
Burralow picnic and camping area access
Burralow picnic and camping area is open: access via Tabaraga Fire Trail ONLY. The Burralow Bridge from Paterson Range fire trail remains closed to all vehicles until structural repairs to the bridge have been completed.
For updates and further information phone the NPWS Blackheath office 02 4787 8877, 9.00 am-4.30 pm seven days, or Richmond office on 02 4588 2400 9.00am-5.00 pm weekdays.
Campsites at Euroka - Euroka campground
Darug campsite now closed until further notice for maintenance and upgrade.
Camping is available at other sites at Euroka. For bookings and further information phone 02 4588 2400 Mon-Thurs. (except school holidays and public holidays) or 02 4739 2950 weekends.
Claustral Canyon
Access to Claustral Canyon via the usual route across private land at Mt Tomah is no longer possible due to landholders denying access.  NPWS has sought alternative access to Claustral through private land without success.  Canyoners should respect the rights of Mt Tomah residents and avoid using private land.
Grand Canyon Walking Track
Part of the Grand Canyon walking track will be closed all day Tuesday 25th September and Wednesday 26th September, 2012, due to helicopter lifting in materials for further track work (weather permitting). 
 There will be no access to the Grand Canyon from:
Evans Lookout
Junction Rock in the Grose Valley
Point Pilcher Track from Medlow Bath.

The Loop car park on Evans Lookout Rd remains closed
 The following will remain open:
 Access to Grand Canyon via Neates Glen – short walk possible, return by same route
Cliff Top Track
Braeside Track
Evans Lookout
 NPWS Heritage Centre is open 7 days a week for information.  Tel: 4787 8877
Ingar camping areas - Ingar campground
Ingar Campsite Loop Road is closed due to wash outs and muddy road conditions.  The day use area and car park remain open. This means that campers must walk from the day use area to campsites (about 100m).
For further information contact the NPWS Heritage Centre, phone 02 4787 8877; open seven days 9.00 am to 4.30 pm.
Loop Car Park, Evans Lookout Rd, Blackheath
 
The Loop car park on Evans Lookout Rd will be closed from Friday 14th September until further notice to allow materials to be prepared for a forthcoming helicopter operation.
Parking is available at Evans Lookout or Neates Glen car parks.
Walkers will still have access through the car park 
 NPWS Heritage Centre is open 7 days a week for information.  Tel: 4787 8877
 
The Oaks Firetrail closed
Due to essential road maintenance works the Oaks Fire Trail in Blue Mountains National Park near Glenbrook will be closed to vehicles until further notice. The road to Jellybean Pool, Euroka and Mount Portal will remain open.
Vehicle access will be closed to Red Hands Cave Road and Nepean Lookout Road.  The Woodford Oaks Firetrail and cycle track along the Oaks Firetrail will be open for cyclists.
For more information please contact Richmond Office Mon to Thurs 9-4.30 0245 882400 or the Blue Mountains Heritage Centre 7 days a week 9-4.30 0247 873101

item.title: Bomaderry Creek Regional Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of loop track
The short (1 hour) loop walking track is closed at Mossy Gully until further notice. A bridge is out due to flood damage.

item.title: Bouddi National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Old Wagstaffe Fire Trail - no public access available through private property.
No public access is available through private property. Signs indicate where public access is not permitted.
Temporary closure of Putty Beach Camping and Picnic Areas
Putty Beach Camping and Picnic Areas will be temporarily closed while redevelopment works are undertaken from 3rd September until 21st December 2012, weather permitting. During this period access to Putty Beach and the Bouddi Coastal Walking Track will be available via Killcare Beach.
For further information contact NPWS Gosford Ph 4320 4200.

item.title: Bowraville Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
No access via Bowraville Road
Entry to the nature reserve via Bowraville Rd is closed until further notice. The reserve can be acessed via Valley Trail to the east and Tombstone Trail to the west.

item.title: Brimbin Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Due to flooding, Tommy Owens Crossing and Miss Kelly's Walking Track are temporarily closed.
Due flooding Tommy Owens Crossing on Tommy Owens Creek and part of Miss Kelly's walking track remains temporarily CLOSED.
All other areas of the reserve is open to the public.
  • NPWS will continue to assess these flood affected areas, and will reopen them when conditions & safety improves.
For further information contact NPWS Manning Area office on (02) 6552 4097.

item.title: Budderoo National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Lees Rd lookouts and Carpark Closure (Ends Tuesday 9 October)
Lees Rd Lookouts and Carparks are closed to vehicle and foot traffic until further notice due to confirmed asbestos contamination of road fill on Lees Rd.

item.title: Bundjalung National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
No 4WD beach access from Black Rocks campground - Black Rocks campground
Due to significant storm damage, the 4WD beach access at Black Rocks Camping Area is CLOSED. Vehicles may still drive along Ten Mile Beach north from the Shark Bay 4WD beach access, but cannot exit at Black Rocks. There are no other beach access points on Ten Mile Beach other than Shark Bay 4WD beach access.  No 4WD access north of Black Rocks camping area.

item.title: Cape Byron State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Tallow Beach Road and Cosy Corner Picnic Area in Cape Byron SCA will be due to a hazard reduction burn
The NPWS are proposing to undertake a hazard reduction burn on the north-western section of Arakwal National Park, Byron Bay.  The proposed burn will be undertaken in September to October.  The exact timing of the burn is dependant upon forecast weather conditions and subsequently may be postponed if conditions are not favourable.  On the day of the burn traffic control measures will be put in place.  During the burn operation Tallow Beach Road and Cosy Corner picnic area within the Cape Byron SCA and track will be closed to pedestrian and vehicle traffic.

item.title: Cocoparra National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Cocoparra NP open, please use caution on roads
Cocoparra National Parks is open. please use caution on all access trails (as there are still pot holes and erosion issues from the flooding).For more information please call the Griffith office on 02 69668100.

item.title: Conjola National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Bridge Replacement on Grasstree Rd
Grasstree Rd (between Blackbutt and Red Head Forest Rd) will be closed until further notice due to bridge replacement works.  Please contact NPWS Ulladulla on 0244549500 for any further information.

item.title: Coocumbac Island Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Coocumbac Island Nature Reserve is closed until further notice, due to flooding of the Manning River.
For further information contact the NPWS Manning Area office on 02 6552 4097.

item.title: Cottan-Bimbang National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Knoddingbul Road damaged
Knoddingbul Road and Stockyard Creek Road are both closed at Oxley Highway due to the untrafficable surface on Knoddingbul Road. Access is available to Maxwell's Flat Camping Area from the south via Tapin Tops or Elands. For more information contact the Hastings Area National Parks & Wildlife Service Office 6588 5555 during office hours.

item.title: Deua National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Some Fire Trails not suitable for trailer access
NPWS has identified five trails within Deua National Park that are unsuitable for all trailer access, due to the current and increasing cost of road and trail maintenance.  This is because of damage to trail drainage structures from the use (or inappropriate use) of 4WDs towing trailers and wheel skidding on steeper sections of trail, lack of traction in wet weather, and towing and winching activities in recovery of stranded vehicles.
The NPWS asks that you keep all trailers away from these identified trails. By doing this you reduce the safety risk to yourself and others, reduce damage to the park environment and your assets, and reduce park maintenance costs – a benefit for us and for you.
These five trails are: Dampier Mountain Fire Trail, Minuma Range Fire Trail, Mongamula Fire Trail, Merricumbene Fire Trail, and Dry Creek Fire Trail. These trails have been sign-posted to show they are not suitable for trailers.
Alternative trailer access to Bendethera camping area is available from Moruya via Little Sugarloaf Road and Bendethera Fire Trail. From Braidwood, this increases travel time by about ½ to 1 hour.
Find out more about trailer access in this park.

item.title: Gardens of Stone National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Ben Bullen Trail
Due to wet weather the Ben Bullen Trail (from Ben Bullen to Baal Bone Gap through Gardens of Stone National Park and Wolgan State Forest) is very difficult to pass with numerous boggy sections.  It is likely that these conditions will persist until such time as it dries out.

item.title: Goobang National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Temporary trail closure
Spring Creek Fire Trail will be temporarily CLOSED to vehicles between Peak Hill-Baldry Road to the north and Renshaw McGirr Way to the south.  This trail will remain closed until further notice.  NPWS will continue to assess the affected areas and will reopen the trail when conditions & safety improve. 
For further information please contact the local Forbes Office on 02 6851 4429.

item.title: Gourock National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of trails due to storm damage
Due to storm damage, the following trails are closed from 31 May 2010 until further notice:
  • Green Hills Fire Trail
  • Rocky Range Fire Trail
Contact Narooma NPWS office for more information, ph: 4476 0800.

item.title: Gulguer Nature Reserve
item.description:
HAZARD REDUCTION BURNS
Hazard reduction burn
The National Parks & Wildlife Service and the Rural Fire Service are proposing to undertake a hazard reduction burn on the south-western ridge of Gulguer Nature Reserve, Greendale.  
At this point in time the proposed date will be Thursday 19th April. It should be emphasised that the exact timing of the burn is dependent upon forecast weather conditions and subsequently may be postponed if conditions are not favourable. It there is a need to reschedule it is likely to be within a 6-8 week period.
On the day of the burn it is suggested that in order to minimise smoke disruption to your home, you close windows and doors, remove washing from your clothesline, secure domestic pets and retract pool covers to prevent ember damage, etc.
During the burn sections of the park, tracks and trails will be closed to the public.
Should you require any further information contact the Cumberland South Area office on 47748662.

item.title: Illawarra Escarpment State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Areas closed due to rock falls
The following areas within Illawarra Escarpment State Conservation Area are closed owing to land slide and rock fall hazards:
  • Five Islands Lookout, Mount Keira.
  • Area below Mount Keira summit, bounded in the north by the summit cliff line and Dave Walsh's Track, in the west and south by Mount Keira Road and in the east by a line from Geordies Flat (hairpin bend) to Victoria Lookout.
For further information phone the NPWS Illawarra Area office on (02) 4223 3000.

item.title: Jenolan Karst Conservation Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
'Karawina' rehabilitation
The area known as 'Karawina' is closed for rehabilitation.  Access to walkers only; there is no access for vehicles.

item.title: Jervis Bay National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Track to Red Point, Jervis Bay National Park closed - Red Point picnic area (Ends Saturday 1 December)
The track to Red Point (Red Rocks) will remain closed until 1 December 2012 to allow public pedestrian access to be constructed to Jervis Bay through Jervis Bay National Park.  Vehicle access to the foreshore will not be possible due to the road traversing private land.
We apologise for the inconvenience.  For further information please contact the National Parks & Wildlife Service, Nowra Area office on 44286300.

item.title: Jilliby State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of Middle Ridge Road
Middle Ridge Road is closed until further notice due to an infestation of Myrtle Rust.
Closure of Watagans Forest Road
Watagans Forest Road will be closed until further notice while road works are undertaken.
Drivers are cautioned to take care on roads after rain
All roads in Jilliby SCA can be slippery after rain events. Drivers are cautioned to take extreme care - roads are most suitable to 4WDs.
Lemon Tree Forest Road
Lemon Tree Forest Road in Jilliby SCA is temporarily closed until further notice to all vehicles from Prickly Ridge Road to Yambo Forest Road due to road damage from rain and vehicle activity.
Prickly Ridge Road is only suitable for 4WD
Currently Prickly Ridge Road is only suitable for 4WD between Cut Rock Rd west to Watagan Forest Road

item.title: Kanangra-Boyd National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Beefsteak Creek Fire trail closed
Beefsteak Creek fire trail is closed for maintenance.

item.title: Kemps Creek Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
This reserve is closed until further notice. NPWS apologises for any inconvenience.

item.title: Kinchega National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
General closure information
Due to changing weather conditions that have been experienced in the Far West Region, any visitors planning to visit Kinchega should phone the Kinchega National Park office (08 8091 4214), or the Broken Hill Area office (08 8080 3200) before visiting to get the latest information on current road conditions and closures.
Kinchega National Park's River Drive has the following campsites open.  These are numbered 1 and 2; numbered 23 to 30; number 34.  The remaining campsites on the River Drive remain closed.
DATE:       as of 21.09.2012
RIVER DRIVE:  CLOSED
WOOLSHED DRIVE:   OPEN  
LAKE DRIVE:  CLOSED  
EMU LAKE DRIVE: OPEN
(Alternate access to the historic Kinchega Woolshed)
 
OLD POONCARIE ROAD / TANDOU ROAD: 
Menindee Road to Emu Lake Drive: OPEN  
Emu Lake Drive to Tandou Station boundary: OPEN  



ROAD INFORMATION/CONTACTS IN REGIONAL NSW/WESTERN DISTRICT: Roads and Traffic Authority (RTA) and Shire/Council roads may be closed due to flooding and/or rains in the areas of Bourke, Central Darling Shire (Wilcannia, Ivanhoe, White Cliffs, Menindee, Pooncarie), Broken Hill area and the Unincorporated areas.  It is suggested that enquiries should be made to the relevant authority for road conditions prior to travel.
Please note: Driving on a closed road  can lead to heavy penalties. Approximately $1100.00 fine per axle from road authorities plus additional fines from NSW National Parks & Wildlife if driving on a closed road within a National Park or Reserve.

LOCATION
 PHONE
 WEBSITE and/or other information
NSW RTA
 24 hour information line: 132701
 Live updates & traveller information for NSW roads can be viewed at the RMS Live Traffic NSW website:  http://livetraffic.rta.nsw.gov.au/  
Broken Hill RTA
 Recorded message 24 hours: 08 8082 6660
 24 Hour Contact: Traffic Information Line 132 701
Unsealed Roads 0429 394 612
Road Condition Broadcast (24hr Recorded Message) 08 8082 6660
Office Hours: Roads and Maritime Services 08 8082 6699 / After Hours:  Sealed Roads 0429 346 432
Central Darling Shire
 http://centraldarling-new.local-e.nsw.gov.au/index.php?option=com_jentlacontent&view=category&id=1524&Itemid=2032
Cobar Shire Council
 (02) 6836 5888
 www.cobar.nsw.gov.au
Bourke Shire Council
 (02) 6830 8000 
 AH: 0419 722 055
Wentworth Shire Road
 http://www.wentworth.nsw.gov.au/services/RoadClosures.php
Including the Arumpo Road to Mungo National Park.
Victorian Road
 http://alerts.vicroads.vic.gov.au
If the road you are wanting to view is not on this alert you can call the Vic Roads Traffic Management Centre on 13 11 70.

Locations affected: Cawndilla campground, Morton Boulka picnic area, PS Providence historic site
KINCHEGA LIMITED CAMPSITES ON THE RIVER DRIVE.
Due to changing weather conditions that have been experienced in the Far West Region, any visitors planning to visit Kinchega should phone the Kinchega National Park office (08 8091 4214), or the Broken Hill Area office (08 8080 3200) before visiting to get the latest information on current road conditions and closures.
Kinchega National Park's River Drive has the following campsites open.  These are numbered 1 and 2; numbered 23 to 30; number 34.  The remaining campsites on the River Drive are closed.
DATE:       as of 21.09.2012
RIVER DRIVE:  partly CLOSED
WOOLSHED DRIVE:   OPEN  
LAKE DRIVE:  CLOSED  
EMU LAKE DRIVE: OPEN
(Alternate access to the historic Kinchega Woolshed)
 OLD POONCARIE ROAD / TANDOU ROAD: 
Menindee Road to Emu Lake Drive: OPEN  
Emu Lake Drive to Tandou Station boundary: OPEN 
Limited camping sites
Limited camping sites: please contact the Broken Hill office (T: 08 8080 3200) for further updates.
Available sites
Emu Lake camping area: Emu Lake camping area has re-opened following its redesign. It is situated close (~500m) to the Kinchega Woolshed and Shearers Quarters complex. It is accessible from Woolshed Drive.
River Drive camping area: Campsites 1, 2 and 23 to 30 and 34 are open on the River Drive. The campsite is accessible from the main entrance to Kinchega National Park (Tandou Road).
Locations affected: Lake Cawndilla camping ground, Darling River camping grounds
Locations affected: Cawndilla campground, Darling River campground
roads closed due to flood waters
FOR FURTHER INFORMATION CONTACT Broken Hill Area office:  08 8080 3200 (M - F business hours 8.30 to 4.30 CST – Central Standard Time).
General closure information
Due to changing weather conditions visitors planning to visit Kinchega should phone the Broken Hill Area office (08 8080 3200) prior to travel to obtain the latest information on current road conditions and closures.
Locations affected: Lake Cawndilla camping ground, Morton Boulka Picnic Area, the River Drive
Limited camping sites
Lake Cawndilla camping area is currently inaccessible due to the closure of Lake Drive. This section of road has been closed due to its poor condition and its significance with regard to Aboriginal cultural heritage sites. Major road works need to be carried out before it can be accessed once more. Works to fix this road have been scheduled for August 2012.
Many campsites located along the River Drive as well as the PS Providence site are currently inaccessible due to this section of the park being affected by increased flows of the Darling River.  At present much of the River Drive and associated campsites are being restored following the flooding of the Darling River.
Available sites
Emu Lake camping area
Emu Lake camping area has re-opened following its redesign.  It is situated close (~500m) to the Kinchega Woolshed and Shearers Quarters complex.  It is accessible from Woolshed Drive.
River Drive camping area
Campsites 1, 2 and  23 to 30 and 34 are open on the River Drive.  These are accessible from the main entrance to Kinchega National Park (Tandou Road) and from Woolshed Drive.
You may noticed a lack of park facilities along the River Drive, including toilets, picnic tables and wood fire BBQs.  Much of our park resources were damaged or lost during the flooding of the Darling River recently.  Kinchega National Park staff have begun work to restore infrastructure to all of our campsites.
Locations affected: Lake Cawndilla camping ground, Darling River camping grounds
Road closures due to damaged roads 
The following drives are closed to the public until further notice. 
  • River Drive: closed.
  • Lake Drive: closed.
River Drive is currently inaccessible due to this section of the park being affected by increased flow rates of the Darling River. At present much of the River Drive and associated campsites are being restored following the flooding of the Darling River. Lake Drive will be reopened after major road works have been completed.  These road works are scheduled to start in August 2012.
Please contact the Broken Hill NPWS office 08 8080 3200 during business hours (M – F 8.30am to 4.30pm CST) for more information.
Park fire ban
A park fire ban applies in the park. (Ends Thursday 1 March 2012, 11:59PM)
A local fire ban is put in place at Kinchega National Park every year between 31 October and 1 March.  No solid fuel fires are permitted during this time.
Park fire bans are imposed by NPWS managers for a particular park or reserve.
When a park fire ban is in place, you can't light a fire using solid fuels such as timber, charcoal or heat beads. However, the use of gas-fired and electrical appliances may be permitted for cooking where:
  • the appliance is under the direct control of an adult;
  • the appliance is placed or located in an area where there is no combustible material within three metres; and
  • there is an adequate water supply to extinguish fire adjacent to the appliances.
To get more details on what you can and can't do while this park fire ban is in place, contact the Broken Hill  office.
More information
  • Find out more about fire bans in parks and reserves

item.title: Kosciuszko National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Bridge washed away on Buddong Falls Track - Buddong Falls track
Storms have washed away the bridge on the Buddong Falls Walking Track and a diversion is now in place.
  • Land slips have closed the track below the upper falls meaning there is no access to the lower falls until further notice.
  • The upper falls can still be viewed.
  • Caution is required on the Power line access road due to land slips.
  • Access to Buddong Falls via the State Forest road coming from Batlow is not recommended.

Port Phillip Fire Trail is closed at the causeway of Tantangra dam - Ghost Gully campground
Access is open to camp grounds along the Port Phillip Fire Trail and to the Tantangra Dam but due to high water levels the causeway is closed.
Road and trail closures, Goobragandra Powerline Road - Broken Cart campground
The following trails will remain closed until further notice.
  • Goobragandra Powerline Road.  This applies to vehicle access only.
For more information contact the Tumut Region Visitor Centre on 02 69477025
The Tin Mines Barn within the Pilot Wilderness Area is closed
The Tin Mines Barn within the Pilot Wilderness Area is closed for general public use whilst reconstruction work in carried out on the buildings chimney structure. Work is not expected to be completed until December 2012.
The adjoining Managers Hut (Carters Hut) and its fireplace is still available for use – Further information contact the Ranger on 6450 5577
Toilets Closed
Rawson Pass toilets are now closed for the Winter Season
Winter Road Closure (Ends Friday 5 October)
Geehi Dam Road is closed from Olsen's Lookout to the Geehi Dam
Winter Road Closure
Cabramurra to Khancoban Road (KNP5) has been closed for the winter season.
Winter Road Closure (Ends Friday 5 October)
The Kosciuszko Road is closed from Perisher to Charlotte Pass for the winter season.
Winter Road Closure (Ends Friday 5 October)
Northern End Winter Road Closures
  • Long Plain Road
  • Goobragandra Powerline Road
  • Kings Cross Road
  • Port Phillip Fire Trail
  • Brokencart Track
  • Pocket Saddle Road to Currango
  • Four Mile Hill Road
  • Cumberland Trail

item.title: Ku-ring-gai Chase National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
No access past Empire Marina building to North Turramurra and St Ives.
Due to a fire on Saturday 21st July 2012 there is no access past Empire Marina which prevents the Bobbin Head, Sphinx and Warrimoo Tracks from accessing Bobbin Head. It is currently unknown when this will be reopened.
Locations affected: Sphinx Track and Warrimoo Track to Bobbin Head, Bobbin Head

item.title: Lansdowne Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Lansdowne Nature Reserve, Lansdowne Wharf currently closed to vehicles.
Lansdowne Nature Reserve, Lansdowne Wharf remains CLOSED to vehicle access due to safety.
The Rest of the Reserve is open to the public.
For further information please contact the NPWS Manning Area on (02) 6552 4097.

item.title: Leacock Regional Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Cycle way undergoing improvement work
The Glenfield Fire Trail cycle track – possible diversion. 
Commencing 1 June, improvement works will be carried out to upgrade the Glenfield cycleway facility within Leacock Regional Park. Track diversions may be put in place from time to time – please check for updates. Work is expected to be completed by mid September, 2011.

item.title: Ledknapper Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Enquiries to Bourke Area Office t: 02 6872 2744
Gundabooka National Park & SCA:                       CLOSED due to FLOODING
Culgoa National Park:                                         CLOSED due to FLOODING
Nocoleche Nature Reserve (Day Use Area):          CLOSED due to FLOODING
Toorale National Park & SCA:                              CLOSED due to FLOODING
 
Anyone travelling to the Bourke Area is advised to contact either our office (02) 6872 2744 or the Bourke Shire Council on (02) 6830 8000 BEFORE finalising their plans for an up to date report on road conditions.
Roads and Traffic Authority (RTA) and Shire/Council roads may be closed due to flooding and/or rains in the areas of Bourke, Central Darling Shire, Broken Hill area and the Unincorporated areas.  It is suggested that enquiries should be made to the relevant authority for road conditions prior to travel.
Please note: Driving on a closed road can lead to heavy penalties: Approximately $1100.00 fine per axle from road authorities plus additional fines from NSW National Parks & Wildlife if driving on a closed road within a National Park or Reserve.

item.title: Meroo National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Changes to Camping Areas Within Meroo National Park
In accordance with the Meroo National Park Management Plan changes have been made to camping arrangements within the park. 
  • Camping is no longer permitted at Stokes Island due to unsustainable damage to coastal habitat. This area is being converted to a day use area.
  • Camping at Sunburnt Beach has been changed to walk-in camping only. A new campers car park is located 50-100m  from the camping area. No facilities are provided.
  • Camping at Termeil Point has been reduced in area and is now restricted to 11 delineated sites.  Toilet facilities are now available at this location. 
For further information on changes to the camping arrangements please phone the NPWS Ulladulla office on 02 44549500.

item.title: Mororo Creek Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Mororo Creek Nature Reserve access through Banana Road is closed due to a bridge collapse.  Access to the reserve is unavailable until further notice.

item.title: Morton National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Tianjara Artillery Impact Area
The Tianjara Artillery Impact Area, in the northeastern part of the Budawangs, is permanently closed to certain activities because of danger from Unexploded Ordnance.
Walkers must keep to vehicle trails or the Folly Point walking track and no off-track walking is permitted. Digging and campfires are not permitted along tracks. Camping may only occur at the Sassafras or Tianjara Link Road camping area and campfires are only permitted at the Sassafras camping area.
The area is shown on the latest 1:25,000 topographic maps (third edition) and the map in the guidelines for walking in the Budawang Wilderness.
FIRE BAN
A park fire ban applies in the park.
(Ends Friday 28 September)
The Bundanoon area of Morton National Park, from Gambells Rest picnic ground to Echo Point will be closed from the 26th to 28th September 2012 inclusive, for hazard reduction burning operations.

item.title: Mount Canobolas State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Powerline trail closure due to works (Ends Wednesday 31 October)
The area along the power line to the summit of Mount Canobolas is currently closed to the public until 31 October 2012.  The closure is to allow works related to the telecommunication infrastructure on the summit.
For further information, please call the Macquarie Area office on 02 6332 7640.
FUTURE CLOSURES AND FIRE BANS: see upcoming alerts.

item.title: Mount Imlay National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Forestry activities affecting access to Mt Imlay walking track
Forests NSW  will be commencing harvesting operations in East Boyd State Forest which is accessed by Burrawang Rd, the main access to Mt Imlay Walking Track. Harvesting will occur over the next 4-6 weeks (approximately end of September 2010).  During this time the road may have a barrier across with a UHF radio located at the barrier which people can use to advise the logging crew they are in the area.  For those with their own UHF the channel will be posted on the sign.  Delays may occur.  Please be aware of the increase of trucks hauling out of this area.

item.title: Mount Royal National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Carrow Brook walking track is closed due to Myrtle Rust infestation
Carrow Brook walking track is closed until further notice due to an infestation of myrtle rust disease. 
Mt Royal Road is closed until further notice
Mount Royal Road is closed until further notice. Heavy rainfall over the past 6 months has now made the road extremely dangerous. Repairs to the road will be undertaken as soon as possible, weather permitting. For more information contact Ph 6574 5555

item.title: Murray Valley National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Sections of the park are inaccessible due to flooding
Warning – please do not drive through flood water.
For more information call the Moama National Parks and Wildlife Service Office on 03 5483 9100
  • Barooga Precinct (National Park) is open but limited. Please do not drive through water.
  • Boomanoomana Precinct (National Park) is limited access, One Tree Beach road closed.
  • Corowa Precinct (National Park) is open but limited. Please do not drive through water.
  • Cottadidda Precinct (National Park) has closed access to Quicks beach, other limited access.
  • Gulpa Precinct (National Park) is mostly open with some limited access. Most Gulpa Creek areas are accessible. No Edwards River access apart from . Taylors Bridge Road closed. Please do not drive through water.
  • Millewa Precinct (National Park) –limited access, no access via Millewa River Road or Fishermans Road. There are still some wet sections within the precinct - please do not drive through water.
  • Moira Precinct (National Park) is open, but limited. All sites can be accessed along River Road from Greensborough to just before Swifts Creek. Some 4WD only. Access near Moira Lake is not possible. Access to the river via the Cobb Highway is closed apart from Poverty Point Rd.
  • Woperana Precinct (National Park) is closed.
  • Bama Precinct (Regional Park) is 4x4 only.
  • Benarca Precinct (Regional Park) is open. If rainfall is high you may not be able to get to the beach area as water may be over the causeway.
  • Collendina Precinct (Regional Park) is open
  • Gulpa Island Precinct (Regional Park) is open. Most camping site along Gulpa Creek are accessible, and along the Edwards River along Junction Rd.
  • Horseshoe Lagoon Precinct (Regional Park) is open.
  • Millewa Precinct (Regional Park) – access to campsites limited and no access along Millewa River Road. Please do not drive through water. 
  • Moama (Five mile) Precinct (Regional Park) is open
  • Moira Precinct (Regional Park) is open with camping sites at Edwards River Bridge.
  • Mulwala Precinct (Regional Park) is open
  • Quat Quatta and Quat Quatta East Precinct (Regional Park) open.
  • Werai precinct is closed.
  • Deniliquin Precinct (Regional Park) is closed to vehicles owing to flood water, however it is still open to foot traffic.

item.title: Murray Valley Regional Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Sections of park inaccessible due to flooding
Warning – please do not drive through flood water.
For more information call the Moama National Parks and Wildlife Service Office on 03 5483 9100
  • Barooga Precinct (National Park) is open but limited. Please do not drive through water.
  • Boomanoomana Precinct (National Park) is limited access, One Tree Beach road closed.
  • Corowa Precinct (National Park) is open but limited. Please do not drive through water.

  • Gulpa Precinct (National Park) is mostly open with some limited access. Most Gulpa Creek areas are accessible. No Edwards River access apart from . Taylors Bridge Road closed. Please do not drive through water.
  • Millewa Precinct (National Park) –limited access, no access via Millewa River Road or Fishermans Road. There are still some wet sections within the precinct - please do not drive through water.
  • Moira Precinct (National Park) is open, but limited. All sites can be accessed along River Road from Greensborough to just before Swifts Creek. Some 4WD only. Access near Moira Lake is not possible. Access to the river via the Cobb Highway is closed apart from Poverty Point Rd.
  • Woperana Precinct (National Park) is closed.
  • Bama Precinct (Regional Park) is 4x4 only.
  • Benarca Precinct (Regional Park) is open. If rainfall is high you may not be able to get to the beach area as water may be over the causeway.
  • Collendina Precinct (Regional Park) is open
  • Gulpa Island Precinct (Regional Park) is open. Most camping site along Gulpa Creek are accessible, and along the Edwards River along Junction Rd.
  • Horseshoe Lagoon Precinct (Regional Park) is open.
  • Millewa Precinct (Regional Park) – access to campsites limited and no access along Millewa River Road. Please do not drive through water. 
  • Moama (Five mile) Precinct (Regional Park) is open
  • Moira Precinct (Regional Park) is open with camping sites at Edwards River Bridge.
  • Mulwala Precinct (Regional Park) is open
  • Quat Quatta and Quat Quatta East Precinct (Regional Park) open.
  • Werai precinct is closed.
  • Deniliquin Precinct (Regional Park) is closed to vehicles owing to flood water, however it is still open to foot traffic.

item.title: Murrumbidgee Valley Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of Narrandera area, Griffith area
Some precincts in Murrumbidgee Valley National Park have reopened with caution. Road damage has occurred due to flooding. Care should be taken when accessing precincts in the National Park.

     Benerembah
 Caution - Roads damaged
     Billenbah
 open

     Cuba

     Willbriggie

Murrumbidgee Valley Nature Reserve and Murrumbidgee Valley Regional Park,
both located at Narrandera remain closed.

item.title: Murrumbidgee Valley Regional Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
partial closures in Murrumbidgee Valley Nature Reserve and Murrumbidgee Valley Regional Park,
Murrumbidgee Valley Nature Reserve and Murrumbidgee Valley Regional Park,
both located at Narrandera remain closed.
Some precincts in Murrumbidgee Valley National Park have reopened with caution. Road damage has occurred due to flooding. Care should be taken when accessing precincts in the National Park.

item.title: Myall Lakes National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Stoney Creek Road partially closed due to poor condition
Stoney Creek Road Wootton is closed due to poor surface condition. The recent wet weather has resulted in slippery conditions, as the road had just been graded. The closure will help to reduce damage to the road surface and assist with public safety. The section of road affected is from The Grandis west to the park boundary. This effectively closes Stoney Creek Road from the Grandis to the Old Pacific Highway (Wootton Way) Park neighbours will have access to their properties. The closure will remain in place until the road surface dries out. For more information please contact the Great Lakes Area Office on 02 6591 0300
Locations affected: Stoney Creek Road, Grandis picnic area

item.title: Nadgee Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Road conditions
Access to Green Glade on the Nadgee Road to the Nature Reserve boundary is currently unsuitable for 2WD vehicles until maintenance works are undertaken by Bega Valley Shire Council

item.title: Nattai National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Access restrictions and river crossing warnings
  • Sections of this park are located within Special Water Catchment Areas (Schedule 1 and 2). Access restrictions apply.
  • Public vehicular access along Sheehys Creek Road is not permitted until further notice. Yerranderie Escorted Access tours are suspended until further notice.
  • The Wollondilly River crossing is closed to vehicles. Caution required by bushwalkers at river crossings, including the Wollondilly River, due to elevated levels.
For further enquiries please contact the NPWS Nattai Area Office, ph: 4677 0859.

item.title: Nattai State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Access restrictions and river crossing warnings
  • Caution required by bushwalkers at river crossings, including the Wollondilly River, due to elevated water levels.
  • This reserve is located within Special Water Catchment Areas (Schedule 1). Access restrictions apply.
  • Yerranderie Escorted Access tours are suspended due to road conditions.
For further enquiries please contact the NPWS Nattai Area Office, ph: 4677 0859.

item.title: New England National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Bridge out on Hickeys Creek Road
No access to the south-east corner of New England National Park near Bellbrook from Hickeys Creek Road due to bridge closure in adjoining state forest.
Closure of Kilprotay Road
Kilprotay Road is closed from Mt Killiekrankie (just north of the intersection with the Horseshoe Road) in the north to Nulla Nulla in the south.
Please contact NPWS Dorrigo Plateau Area office on 02 6657 2309 for more information.

item.title: Nightcap National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closures due to road works
The Gibbergunyah Range Road – Tungun Road – Peates Mountain Road remains closed. Road works and other remedial works are in progress. Further safety assessments will be undertaken on completion of the roadworks. The road to remain closed until further notice.

item.title: Nymboi-Binderay National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Cod Hole camping area closed due to flood damage
Cod Hole camping area is closed until further notice. The nearest alternative campground is at Platypus Flat. Please contact the park office for more information.  
Toilet facilities closed - The Junction campground
Due to arson, the toilet facilities are closed at The Junction camping area. A temporary toilet strucutre is provided. Alternative facilities are available at Platypus Flat camping area and Norman Jolly picnic area in the southern section of the park.

item.title: Oxley Wild Rivers National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of Michaeliana walk - Michaeliana walk
This track is closed until further notice.

item.title: Pilliga National Park
item.description:
HAZARD REDUCTION BURNS
Hazard reduction burn
The National Parks and Wildlife Service will conduct a major hazard reduction in the Pilliga Nature Reserve, 40 kms north east of Coonabarabran starting on Monday 2 April. The burn will continue for a period of up to 2 weeks, weather permitting, and will cover an area of 6,000 ha. People driving on the Newell Highway in that vicinity will see smoke to the east during this time.
Anyone requiring information about the hazard reduction burn should call the Baradine NPWS office on 6843 4000.

item.title: Popran National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Popran Creek Closed within Popran National Park
Popran Creek within Popran National Park has been temporarily closed to public access until further notice. 
There is no access to Popran Creek or areas adjoining the creek for a vertical distance of 15 metres above the creek line. All inquiries regarding the closure - Area Manager Yango (02) 4320 4213.
Temporary closure of Hominy Creek Walking Track
Hominy Creek Walking Track is temporarily closed to visitors due to erosion and poor condition following extreme weather.  The track will remain closed until maintenance work can be completed.  
Access to Emerald Pool is available via the Mount Olive Trail.

item.title: Sherwood Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Road closures
Waihou Road- closed from Morrows Road to junction with Sherwood Road (landslip)
Sherwood Road - closed from Upper Corindi Road to junction with Waihou Road.
Woolgoolga Creek picnic area closed after dark
Woolgoolga Creek Picnic Area, within Sherwood Nature Reserve, Woolgoolga, will be closed from sunset until sunrise during school and public holidays to reduce vandalism.

item.title: South East Forests National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Storm damage and road maintenance
Access to the coastal parts of the park, below the escarpment, are open with the exception of Kingfisher Road. Part of Goodenia Rainforest Walk is curently closed due to fallen tree damage to the lower bridge.  The rest of the track and picnic area are open. For enquiries regarding coastal area access, contact 02 6495 5000.
Postman’s Camp access 4wd only.
Cow Bail Trail is closed due to wet conditions and fallen trees
Mataganah Fire Trail is closed due to an impassable crossing on the Wog River
Enquiries regarding escarpment access may be directed to the Bombala Office on 02 6458 4080 between 09:00 and 12:30

item.title: Sturt National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
MIDDLE ROAD (Western Section) Closed due to flooding.
STURT NATIONAL PARK'S Middle Road (western section) is closed due to flooding.
Closed: As of 19.04.2012 to January 2013.
Middle road (western section) will be reassessed for re-opening in January 2013.
Further detail:  Middle road western section is between Toona Gate and Cameron Corner road.  It is classified as 4WD only.

item.title: Tallaganda National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of Crow Valley Trail
The Crow Valley Trail in the southern section of the park is closed until further notice due to a bridge being damaged by the recent wet weather. Alternative routes around this section of the park include Tumanang Trail and Bald Peak/Flat Range Trails.

item.title: Tapin Tops National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Potaroo Road, Rusty Road and Potaroo Falls Picnic Area Closed due to weather
Rusty Road, Potaroo Road and Potaroo Picnic Area are temporarily closed.
The condition of the road surface has become dangerous and impassable due to the current wet weather.
The condition of the road will be reassessed on Friday 20/04/2012.

item.title: The Rock Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Short term closure of "The Towers" due to Peregrine falcon nesting (Ends Monday 31 December)
It has been decided to close the rock climbing and abseiling wall locally known as “The Towers”, within The Rock Nature Reserve. This closure will be in place until the 31st of December 2012. Peregrine falcons have now started to nest within the rock sports area and evidence suggests that the abandonment of peregrine falcon nesting sites can occur as a result of the presence of rock climbers, especially during the early stages of nesting. This is different to previous years, where Peregrine falcons were observed nesting at the reserve on the south-east rock face, which is approximately 1km from where rock sports are allowed to occur. If you have any questions please call the Murray Area Office between Monday and Friday, 9am - 4pm 03 54839100.

item.title: Toonumbar National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
The eastern section of Toonumbar Forest drive is temporarily closed (Ends Tuesday 27 November)
The eastern section of Toonumbar Forest Drive, from Cox's Road intersection, including Sherwood Picnic Area, is temporarily closed.

item.title: Toorale National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
The park is closed due to wet road conditions.
Please note the following road closures:
Bourke to Louth - closed
Bourke to Cobar - OPEN to light traffic (less than 5 tonne) between 7am to 7pm
Bourke to Brewarrina - closed
Bourke to Nyngan - OPEN with CAUTION.
Anyone travelling to the Bourke Area is advised to contact either our office (02) 6872 2744 or the Bourke Shire Council on (02) 6830 8000 BEFORE finalising their plans for an up-to-date report on road conditions.
Please note that driving on a closed road can lead to heavy penalties; approximately $1100 fine per axle from road authoritieis plus additional fines from NPWS if driving on a closed road within a national park or reserve.

item.title: Toorale State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
The park is closed due to wet road conditions.
Please note the following road closures:
Bourke Area NPWS Parks & Reserve Update for Monday 19th March 2012
Gundabooka National Park & SCA:                      OPEN
Culgoa National Park:                                         CLOSED due to FLOODING
Nocoleche Nature Reserve (Day Use Area):          CLOSED due to FLODDING
Toorale National Park & SCA:                              CLOSED due to FLOODING
Please also note the following Road CLOSURES:
 
Bourke to Cobar:                     OPEN to Light Traffic (less than 5 tonne).
Bourke to Brewarrina              CLOSED
Bourke to Nyngan:                   OPEN

Anyone travelling to the Bourke Area is advised to contact either our office (02) 6872 2744 or the Bourke Shire Council on (02) 6830 8000 BEFORE finalising their plans for an up-to-date report on road conditions.
Please note that driving on a closed road can lead to heavy penalties; approximately $1100 fine per axle from road authoritieis plus additional fines from NPWS if driving on a closed road within a national park or reserve.

item.title: Wadbilliga National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Wadbilliga National Park - Cascades Campground CLOSED - Cascades camping ground
The Cascades campground is temporarily closed due to a number of hazardous trees. Visitors are asked to respect the signs and not to enter the campground until a full assessment and further planning  has been completed by National Parks and Wildlife Service Staff. The Cascades day use carpark and walking tracks to the Tuross Falls and Cascades viewing platforms remain open to the public. For more information, please contact NPWS Bombala 0264584080.

item.title: Washpool National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Hazard reduction
Hazard reduction will be untaken in the area west of Boundary Creek Falls in Gibraltar Range National Parks and in the south western corner of Washpool National Park. Mulligans Hut would be a preferred camping and picnic area.

item.title: Watagans National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Bangalow Road, Bangalow and Gap Creek Camping areas are closed until further notice
Bangalow Road has been affected by  rain and the will remain closed to all vehicles until all repair works have been completed.  This work is weather dependant.
No access to Bangalow and Gap Creek Camping and picnic areas is available.
Click Creek Fire Trail is closed
Click Creek Fire Trail is closed to all vehicles due to storm damage

item.title: Whian Whian State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Closure of Peates Mountain walking trail - Rummery Park campground
Peates Mountain Walking Trail (from Rummery Park to Peates Mountain) is currently closed until bridges are replaced. Significant work to this track is required before it is safe to re-open to the public. Please comply with on-site signage and barriers across the start of the track.  Works are in progress and will be finalised as soon as weather permits.
Closures due to roadworks
The Gibbergunyah Range Road – Tungun Road – Peates Mountain Road remains closed. Road works and other remedial works are in progress. Further safety assessments will be undertaken on completion of the roadworks. The road will remain closed until further notice.

item.title: Willandra National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Access now via Trida - Whealbah Road
Please note access to Willandra National Park has changed, and is now via the Trida-Whealbah Road.  
If travelling from Hillston along the Hillston-Mossgiel Road, drive a further 10 kilometres west (total 53 kilometres) of the existing Willandra direction sign and turn north onto the Trida-Whealbah Road.  Drive northwards another 20 kilometres to reach the park entrance, signposted on the right.  
The camping area / homestead precinct is another 10.3 kilometres east, following the park road along Willandra Creek.  
Accommodation is currently not available. Please contact the Griffith Office from September 2012 to check current availability.

item.title: Windsor Downs Nature Reserve
item.description:
HAZARD REDUCTION BURNS
Hazard reduction burn
Due to a proposed hazard reduction burn Windsor Downs Nature Reserve will be closed from the 24th until the 28th of September.
Please note that the scheduling of the burn is dependant on weather conditions.
The reserve will be reopened on the 29th September after being assessed as safe for public access.
If you have any questions please call the area office on 45723100.

item.title: Wingham Brush Nature Reserve
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Old Wharf
Partial closure to the entrance at the old Wharf.
Flood damage repairs are continuing and sections of the boardwalk that provide access to the reserve may be closed temporarily during re-construction works. For further information, contact the Manning Area office on 02 6552 4097.

item.title: Woko National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Back section of Woko campground closed, due to wet conditions.
The back section of Woko Camping Area has been temporarily closed, due to wet conditions.  It has been sign posted, and fenced off.   Visitors can still camp in the front section of the camping ground, where many sites are available.
For further information contact Barrington Tops Area office on 02 6538 5300.

item.title: Wollemi National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
California Trail is CLOSED
The California Trail is closed for road works from Thursday 25th August 2011 until further notice. For inquiries Ph 6574 5555.
Part of Martindale Trail CLOSED
The Martindale Trail will be closed from Raspberry Junction on the Hunter Main Trail to Parachute Pass at the Martindale Valley. Repair work to damaged sections is being undertaken for visitor safety purposes.

item.title: Wollumbin National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Condowie Road, Brummies Road and North Wollumbin Road CLOSED
Condowie Road, Brummies Road and North Wollumbin Road within Wollumbin National Park remain CLOSED and will remain so for an indeterminate period of time.
The Wollumbin / Mt Warning Summit walking track, Lyrebird walking track, Breakfast Creek and Korrumbyn Creek day use areas within Wollumbin National Park are open now. Visitors should be aware that all walking tracks will be slippery and muddy requiring caution and appropriate footwear.

item.title: Woomargama National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Partial Closure of Tin Mine Trail - Tin Mines campground
The Tin Mine Trail is closed east of the Tin Mine campsite through to Lanky's Road, access to Tin Mine campsite is via the Tunnel Road.

item.title: Worimi National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Partially CLOSED areas Worimi Conservation Lands including Stockton Beach. - Stockton Bight
On Saturday the 30th June 2012, the beach front & Recreational Vehicle Area will re-open for driving, subject to favourable conditions.
For your safety the following temporary restrictions apply:
  • Drive only on the beach front, or in the Recreational Vehicle Area (RVA).
  • The RVA, which is located South of the Lavis Lane access, is open for dune driving.
  • All dunes between the Lavis Lane and Anna Bay accesses are CLOSED to driving.
  • The park is currently CLOSED for all camping.
  • Access via Lavis Lane or Anna Bay entrances only.
Please be aware that if the beach becomes impassable due to changes in conditions, it may be temporarily CLOSED to all vehicles, for public safety.
ON THE SPOT FINES, AND/OR PROSECUTION APPLY.
TIDE WARNING:
At high tide, sections of the beach may be impassable, plan your trip to travel at low tide. If the beach front is too narrow to pass safely, retrace your route. Do not attempt to bypass around the dunes.
It is recommended you do not drive on the beach 2 hours before & after high tide.
http://www.bom.gov.au/oceanography/tides/MAPS/nsw.shtml 
On Saturday 30 June, there will be a large high tide (1.78m) at 5.09pm.
SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS:
  • Soft sand remains in the park.
  • Drive safely and according to conditions.
  • It is recommended that you assess your 4WD's capability for these particular conditions.
  • Changing weather conditions including wind direction, swell & tides, may affect your ability to enter/exit the beach.
Temporary signs are installed, and NPWS Rangers will be patrolling the park daily, to provide information & ensure compliance.

item.title: Yellomundee Regional Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Shaws Farm House site
Due to possible asbestos contamination the area around the former Shaws Farm House site in Yellomundee Regional Park has been closed to all visitors. Signs warn of the potential hazard and all visitors should keep clear of the area. Asbestos presents a health risk when it is airborne. Do not disturb any material if you suspect that it may contain asbestos.
For futher details please contact the Richmond office on 02 4588 2400
or The Blue Mountains Heritage Centre on 02 4787 8877

item.title: Yerranderie State Conservation Area
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Access restrictions and warning on river crossings
Yerranderie Escorted Access tours are suspended until further notice due to road conditions.
Caution is required by bushwalkers at river crossings, including the Wollondilly River, due to elevated water levels.

item.title: Yuraygir National Park
item.description:
CLOSED AREAS
Alternate access for 2WD to Station Creek and Pebbly Beach camping areas
All 2WD and low clearance vehicles should now use McPhillips Road as the main access into Station Creek and Pebbly Beach camping areas as Barcoongere Forest Way is suitable only for 4WD high clearance vehicles. McPhillips Road is six kilometres north of the Barcoongere Forest Way turnoff on the Pacific Highway. Contact the park office on 02 6641 1500.
Locations affected: Station Creek campground, Pebbly Beach campground
